Petar,

I like the fact HyperNEAT uses nodes with differing activation
func=
tions (sine, abs, etc.) instead of just sigmoid.  My understanding
is NEAT =
only uses sigmoid.

Also, my eventual goal is to evolve an agent in a singl=
e time frame,
say daily, then create a role which uses weekly, daily, and h=
ourly
agents in much the same way as the recent multi-agent paper discussed=
.  

You are correct the geometric regularity is not as strong as the
typic=
al robotic examples, but I was intrigued by HN's ability to
scale.  I will =
look into NEAT by itself though.

--Todd

wrote:

at does HyperNEAT to do with it. Unless you

ric regularities in those time series
